definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
to govern/to control/having jurisdiction over/linchpin of a wheel (archaic)/noise of a barrow

sentences.english: The justice ' clerk assert that the justice is functi officio.
sentences.chinese: 法官的祕書宣稱法官已不再有管轄權。

sentences.english: It is a principle of first importance that federal courts are courts of limited jurisdiction.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦法院是有限管轄權法院，這是首要原則。

sentences.english: Objection to the jurisdiction is an important component of the jurisdiction system of civil litigation.
sentences.chinese: 管轄權異議制度是民事訴訟管轄制度的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Objection to the jurisdiction is an important component of the jurisdiction system of civil litigation.
sentences.chinese: 管轄權異議制度是民事訴訟管轄制度的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: The Secretary-General has taken action in all areas of reform under his authority.
sentences.chinese: 祕書長已在受其管轄的全部改革領域採取行動。

sentences.english: Hence, special administrative regions enjoy independent penal jurisdiction of their own.
sentences.chinese: 因此，特別行政區有了獨立的刑事管轄權。

sentences.english: Higher form includes: extradition, transfer of criminal proceedings, and recognition and execution of foreign rulings.
sentences.chinese: 刑事訴訟轉移管轄和外國刑事判決的承認和執行。

sentences.english: Question in this place we go where the jurisdiction of the Yuan Dynasty, when?
sentences.chinese: 提問我們這個地方在元朝時歸哪裏管轄？

sentences.english: That which is outside God's realm is common.
sentences.chinese: 上帝管轄之外的都是普通的。

sentences.english: He set up a claim to jurisdiction over Byland on the ground of affiliation.
sentences.chinese: 他以從屬關係爲理由提出對半島地區擁有管轄權。

sentences.english: In 1066 all of Great Britain and Ireland was run over by the French.
sentences.chinese: 在1066年，法國管轄着整個不列顛和愛爾蘭。

sentences.english: In the Chelyabinsk region there is a village named Paris;
sentences.chinese: 車里雅賓斯克管轄的區域中有個小村莊叫做巴黎。

sentences.english: This case comes under the jurisdiction of a lower court.
sentences.chinese: 這個案件屬於低一級法院的管轄範圍。

sentences.english: Chapter Four discusses China's attitude towards the optional compulsory jurisdiction of ICJ.
sentences.chinese: 第四章考察了中國與國際法院任意強制管轄權。

sentences.english: How many offshore islands are under the jurisdiction of Singapore?
sentences.chinese: 新加坡管轄的離島有多少個？

sentences.english: In 1999, Macao was reintegrated into China as an autonomous region with special status.
sentences.chinese: 1999年，澳門作爲特別行政區重回中國管轄。

definition: to belong to (a category)/to be attached to
to govern/to control/having jurisdiction over/linchpin of a wheel (archaic)/noise of a barrow

local/regional/district (not necessarily formal administrative unit)/region/area/as suffix to city name, means prefecture or county (area administered by a prefecture-level city or county level city)/CL:個|个[ge4]
